javaslang

Interface Algebra.Monoid<A>

  • Type Parameters:
    A - A type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Algebra.Semigroup<A>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    List<T>, Stream<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    List.AbstractList, List.Cons, List.Nil, Stream.AbstractStream, Stream.Cons, Stream.Deferred, Stream.Nil
    Enclosing class:
    Algebra

    public static interface Algebra.Monoid<A>
extends Algebra.Semigroup<A>
    A Monoid is a Semigroup with an identity element zero, i.e. it consits of
    • Some type A
    • An associative binary operation combine, such that combine(combine(x,y),z) == combine(x,combine(y,z)) for any x,y,z of type A.
    • An identity element zero, such that combine(zero(), x) == x == combine(x, zero()) for any x of type A.
